I am with team 5462 and this is our first year doing swerve drive. We have made it a long way, but we have hit a roadblock in our programming and/or \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e Spark Flex controllers. When we deploy the code, we get an orange light on the motor controllers, and the software shows “\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e Fault” under the faults tab. If we try driving with these faults, the motors do not move. We have tried implementing a delay, but we haven’t found a solid work around yet.
